title: Remembering Reggae Star Jimmy Cliff
summary: Jimmy Cliff, a famous reggae singer from Jamaica, has died at 81 years old. He was very important in music and helped people all over the world enjoy reggae songs like 'Wonderful World, Beautiful People'. He also acted in a movie called 'The Harder They Come' that made reggae popular in America. His wife, Latifa Chambers, shared the sad news on Instagram, saying he died from a seizure and pneumonia. Jimmy Cliff was born in Jamaica in 1944 and grew up in a poor family. He started singing in church when he was six and wrote his own songs as a kid. He moved to Kingston when he was 14 and changed his name to Cliff to show he wanted to reach high goals. He will be remembered for his great music and happy spirit.
